title: Osho - Nirvana, The Last Nightmare
description:
Zen and Zen Masters
Nirvana: The Last Nightmare
Talks on Zen
Talks given from 11/02/76 am to 20/02/76 am
English Discourse series
10 Chapters
Year published: 1981

Why does Osho call the desire for nirvana, enlightenment, "the last nightmare"? 
Because, he says, all desire, all hope is the nightmare. 

Through Zen stories and responses to seekersâ€™ questions, Osho speaks on the nature of desire, and the chronic state of schizophrenia inflicted upon mankind by the organized religions. 


Talk #01: Mastered by Zen

Talk #02: The Ultimate Nightmare

Talk #03: Players of a Game

Talk #04: The Drunken Dancer

Talk #05: Killing the Buddha

Talk #06: Taking the Risk

Talk #07: Fingers Pointing to the Moon

Talk #08: Collecting Seashells

Talk #09: Dead with Dignity

Talk #10: Living in Nirvana
